name: EMERGING ECONOMIES

values.comments:
This course explores important issues in conducting business internationally in and with emerging economies. Much of the course attempts to define emerging economies and to understand the changes occurring in these countries. The course also examines the position of emerging economies in the global context, and how broad social issues affect the development of emerging economies and the ability to establish relationships or conduct business in emerging economies.

Students thoroughly enjoyed LGST 216 taught by Professor Nichols. Many students agreed that it was one of their favorite classes at Penn. However, students were somewhat divided over Professor Nichols’ teaching style of “cold calling” students and asking them questions. Some students felt that his unrelenting questioning unnecessarily embarrassed students, whereas others thought that his teaching style successfully maintained student engagement. Those who enjoyed Professor Nichols teaching described him in overwhelmingly positive terms. For example, one student wrote that Professor Nichols was “the best teacher I have ever had in my life. Period,” and another stated that Professor Nichols amazing teaching “made my sophomore semester.” Students agreed that it was important to complete the readings before class, because Professor Nichols could “cold call” on any student and question him or her about the readings.
